greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Prime factorization templates.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
example: Primes are given 1. The next prime factorization pattern is 4=p^2, so a(4)=2 and similarly a(6)=3.
program: (PARI) primetemplate(n)=local(f,fl,res,eres); f=factor(n); fl=length(f[,1]); res=""; for (i=1,fl,res=concat(res,f[,2][i])); eres=eval(res); if (v[eres]==0,v[eres]=vc; vc++); eres vc=1; v=vector(10000); for (j=2,50,print1(v[primetemplate(j)]","))
(PARI) A079616(n) = (A077462(n)-1); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 13 2018, uses code in A077462.
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Jan 29 2003
ext: Term a(1) = 0 prepended, superfluous 1 after that removed, extended up to a(105) - _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 13 2018
